actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Friday, October 13, 2023,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Friday, October 13, 2023, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 406 (Sen. Grassley):
        A resolution to honor the life and death of Richard Clarence Clark, former Senator for the State of Iowa.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN42:
        Karen Sasahara, of Massachusetts, to be Ambassador to the State of Kuwait

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN812:
        Jennifer L. Hall, of Pennsylvania, to be United States District Judge for the District of Delaware

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 63 - 26. Record Vote Number: 254 


        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 10/17/2023.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Ms. Smith, at  6:50 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
